pull_request.title: Use all mavlink includes instead of ardupilotmega for cmake build
pull_request.body:
Switched mavlink include option from 'ardupilotmega' to 'all' in the CMakeLists file. This modification will allow the use of all the functionalities offered by the mavlink library. the range of functionalities that can be utilized from the mavlink library.
@bkueng Please check out this PR because it fixes cmake compilation for StandardModes.

pull_request.title: QGCTextField: fix forcing the use of virtual numeric keyboard
pull_request.body:
**Description:**
This pull request addresses an issue with the input method hints that was causing problems with Android devices, specifically related to the use of the virtual numeric keyboard. The problem arose from an inverted condition, which led to incorrect behavior.

**Changes Made**
Reversed the condition to correctly force the use of the virtual numeric keyboard only when numericValuesOnly is true and the device is not an IOS device.

**Problem**
This condition was causing problems on Android devices by not allowing users to search for parameters or create com link names using alphabetic characters.

![C8AD48CF-62D4-4C4A-B44F-98CE179F3121](https://github.com/mavlink/qgroundcontrol/assets/52117777/e56c5dc0-c624-4a89-8941-abb7a16f2c67)

![7F5A305A-31FB-4299-A1DF-3175BE9278BF](https://github.com/mavlink/qgroundcontrol/assets/52117777/6b4ab1bd-8524-41bb-8485-a33e34119c96)

pull_request.title: Remove old "offboard compass calibration" code
pull_request.body:
We're just about to merge a PR which removes handling of `SET_SENSOOR_OFFSETS` mavlink commands from ArduPilot: https://github.com/ArduPilot/ardupilot/pull/25305

Don added code in 2016 to use ArduPilot's onboard compass calibration...

I've tested QGC after this and it works just fine to calibrate compasses on a CubeOrange

pull_request.title: APMFirmwarePlugin: reposition using MAV_CMD_DO_REPOSITION
pull_request.body:
I've tested this in ArduPilot SITL.

The interface used for this testing was click-on-map and select the "Move to" option.

I tested Rover, Copter and Plane which actually implement DO_REPOSITION, and on Sub which doesn't.  All act as expected.

issue.title: Custom build doesn't work on master branch
issue.body:
When I try to build the custom-example build it gives me some errors (Ubuntu 22.04, I'm building using the comunity docker container):
![Schermata del 2023-10-25 15-52-50](https://github.com/mavlink/qgroundcontrol/assets/120368602/5003acdd-7f09-4675-a2aa-73b76d119b47)
![Schermata del 2023-10-25 15-53-06](https://github.com/mavlink/qgroundcontrol/assets/120368602/85969267-000b-43d1-bcdc-fd69edf069ce)
[](url)


I did all the steps in the README: Rename folder from custom-example to custom, run in it updateqrc.py and compile but it doesn't work.

comment.body:
I tried the build and had the same issue. The problem is because the normal builds now use the mavlink dialect 'all' while the custom build overrides this and uses 'common' which doesnt have the new development messages.
This changed from #10783

You can fix this for now by changing MAVLINK_CONF = common to MAVLINK_CONF = all in custom.pri

There seems to be a bit of discussion about whether using the 'all' dialect for the normal builds is a good idea in #10836, so for now maybe just make the change locally.

issue.title: Can't build Stable_V4.2 QGroundControl, error: C1083: Cannot open include file: 'nlohmann/detail/abi_macros.hpp': No such file or directory
issue.body:
## Expected Behavior
Build and run Stable_V4.2 QGroundControl version.

## Current Behavior
After I pull the code and checkout the Stable_V4.2 branch, I run again: git submodule update --recursive, but I get this error:
fatal: remote error: upload-pack: not our ref 391786c6c3abdd3eeb993a3154f1f2a4cfe137a0
fatal: Fetched in submodule path 'libs/libevents/libevents/libs/cpp/parse/nlohmann_json', but it did not contain 391786c6c3abdd3eeb993a3154f1f2a4cfe137a0. Direct fetching of that commit failed.
fatal: Failed to recurse into submodule path 'libs/libevents/libevents'

Also if I build the code from QtCreator It is failing with this error:
error: C1083: Cannot open include file: 'nlohmann/detail/abi_macros.hpp': No such file or directory
It is strange because several weeks ago I pulled the code from the same branch Stable_V4.2 and it worked.

## Steps to Reproduce:
1. git clone --recursive -j8 https://github.com/mavlink/qgroundcontrol.git
2. git submodule update --recursive
3. git checkout -f Stable_V4.2
4. git submodule update --recursive
5. open qgroundcontrol.pro in QT Creator 
6. wait for indexing
7. build

## System Information
- Operating System: Windows 10
- QGC Version: V4.2
- QT Creator 7.0.2
- Desktop Qt 5.15.2 MSVC2019 64bit Debug

## Detailed Description
![Untitled](https://github.com/mavlink/qgroundcontrol/assets/15063130/9fd775f2-31c4-45a6-930d-18909a96afd0)
![22](https://github.com/mavlink/qgroundcontrol/assets/15063130/e08dd472-4112-4c6b-bafb-56062e05b490)

comment.body: What fixed the issue for me, was to enter each of the directories for the failing nubmodule, and doing ```git reset && git checkout . ```

issue.title: Can't build Stable_V4.2 QGroundControl, error: C1083: Cannot open include file: 'nlohmann/detail/abi_macros.hpp': No such file or directory
issue.body:
## Expected Behavior
Build and run Stable_V4.2 QGroundControl version.

## Current Behavior
After I pull the code and checkout the Stable_V4.2 branch, I run again: git submodule update --recursive, but I get this error:
fatal: remote error: upload-pack: not our ref 391786c6c3abdd3eeb993a3154f1f2a4cfe137a0
fatal: Fetched in submodule path 'libs/libevents/libevents/libs/cpp/parse/nlohmann_json', but it did not contain 391786c6c3abdd3eeb993a3154f1f2a4cfe137a0. Direct fetching of that commit failed.
fatal: Failed to recurse into submodule path 'libs/libevents/libevents'

Also if I build the code from QtCreator It is failing with this error:
error: C1083: Cannot open include file: 'nlohmann/detail/abi_macros.hpp': No such file or directory
It is strange because several weeks ago I pulled the code from the same branch Stable_V4.2 and it worked.

## Steps to Reproduce:
1. git clone --recursive -j8 https://github.com/mavlink/qgroundcontrol.git
2. git submodule update --recursive
3. git checkout -f Stable_V4.2
4. git submodule update --recursive
5. open qgroundcontrol.pro in QT Creator 
6. wait for indexing
7. build

## System Information
- Operating System: Windows 10
- QGC Version: V4.2
- QT Creator 7.0.2
- Desktop Qt 5.15.2 MSVC2019 64bit Debug

## Detailed Description
![Untitled](https://github.com/mavlink/qgroundcontrol/assets/15063130/9fd775f2-31c4-45a6-930d-18909a96afd0)
![22](https://github.com/mavlink/qgroundcontrol/assets/15063130/e08dd472-4112-4c6b-bafb-56062e05b490)

comment.body:
@bkueng just a FYI - libevents is referencing a commit which doesn't exist in the repository referenced in the remote for `nlohmann_json` and this is killing qgroundcontrol builds.  I'm guessing many devs have that as an extra remote.

For others who need a workaround 'til things get fixed, try:
```
cd libs/libevents/libevents/libs/cpp/parse/nlohmann_json
 git remote add nlohmann https://github.com/nlohmann/json
git fetch nlohmann
cd -
git submodule update --init --recursive
```

That should indicate the ref is now present in the subrepository.

Retrying your build should work out better.

comment.body: The condition is literally a shift + click. Which I believe can only be achieved with a keyboard connected. Probably should be changed to a double click or something. And documented on the wiki.

issue.title: Container build error - PermissionError: [Errno 13] Permission denied: '/usr/lib/python3.8
issue.body:
----

## Expected Behavior
Following the steps listed at https://dev.qgroundcontrol.com/master/en/getting_started/container.html to build QGC.
Expect that the build container got built successfully. 

## Current Behavior
There is an error while building the container...
PermissionError: [Errno 13] Permission denied: '/usr/lib/python3.8/__pycache__/__future__.cpython-38.pyc.139795054894752'

## Steps to Reproduce:
1. Install docker using steps here: https://docs.docker.com/engine/install/ubuntu/
2. Using commit "Update PX4 Firmware metadata Fri Dec 30 06:49:42 UTC 2022"
3. docker build --file ./deploy/docker/Dockerfile-build-linux -t qgc-linux-docker .

## System Information
- Operating System: [Ubuntu 22.04.1 LTS]
- QGC sourcecode: 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10469636/223619210-f693ecf9-9bbf-4005-baa7-d0ded5e7b0b8.png)

## Detailed Description
Have reinstalled docker and remove all images but to no avail.

## Log Files and Screenshots
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10469636/223618067-3cbd4dcb-87c9-4bc2-a682-745f046a19c5.png)

comment.body:
> The same problem came to me when I tried to build a docker inside an EC2 instance The Problem: The docker was installed using snap, the problem with this docker is their **storage drivers** To solve the problem (in my case) I have added `"storage-driver": "vfs"` to the `/var/snap/docker/current/config/daemon.json` Also doing that makes all your current containers and images unusable so make sure to close them and restart the docker `sudo snap restart docker`
> 
> ref: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/72564830/python3-minimal-error-during-pip-installation-in-docker-build-permissionerro

This. This so much, I have to use EC2 since my dev computer is an m1 so it cannot build images usable on ECS. I didn't know EC2 used snap, so I couldn't figure out why or how it stopped working.

Absolute life saver!

issue.title: use upstream gst-plugins-good
issue.body:
issue for multiple qmlglsink instances for windows has been fixed in 1.20.0 release

closes #10140

comment.body:
Maybe I misunderstand something, then please correct me if I wrong
1. QGC builds-in one of gst-good plugins (static linkage/linking).
2. QGC uses GStreamer shared libraries anyway. (dynamic linking)
3. Does it make sense to keep step #1 given upstream GStreamer plugins are fine now?
